ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: 1. Did you feel as though the event was reoccurring, like you were reliving it?
Notes: 0= Not at all; 6= A great deal
0= Not at all; 6= A great deal
0= Not at all; 6= A great deal

ElementDescription: 4. Did you have physical reactions in your body (for example, sweaty, racing heart, trembling, short of breath)?
Notes: 0= Not at all; 6= A great deal

ElementDescription: 5. Did you avoid experiencing images, sounds, or smells connected to the event?
Notes: 0= Not at all; 6= A great deal

ElementDescription: 6. Did you avoid thoughts about the event?
Notes: 0= Not at all; 6= A great deal

ElementDescription: 7. Did you avoid feelings about the event?
Notes: 0= Not at all; 6= A great deal

ElementDescription: 8. Did what you were experiencing seem unreal to you, like you were in a dream or watching a movie or play?
Notes: 0= Not at all; 6= A great deal

ElementDescription: 9. Did you feel like you were a spectator watching what was happening to you, like an observer or outsider?
Notes: 0= Not at all; 6= A great deal

ElementDescription: 10. Did you feel disconnected from your body?
Notes: 0= Not at all; 6= A great deal

ElementDescription: 11. Did you feel like you were in a fog?
Notes: 0= Not at all; 6= A great deal
